citations.narrative:
The facility is exhibiting animals which are not authorized on their license. The facility obtained two red foxes on June 15,
2024, and have been exhibiting the animal since approx. mid-July, per the facility representative.
Licenses authorize a specific number and specific type(s) of animals for the use of regulated activity (i.e., exhibiting).
Licensure with the USDA must specifically authorize the use of exotic and wild canids, which include foxes.
The licensee must either remove this animal from exhibition permanently or must obtain a new license which authorizes
the use of this category of animal before continuing to exhibit this animal.
Correct by May 24, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(ii) 
   
Requirements and application 
The facility is exhibiting animals which are not authorized on their license. The facility obtained two red foxes on June 15, 
2024, and have been exhibiting the animal since approx. mid-July, per the facility representative. 
 
Licenses authorize a specific number and specific type(s) of animals for the use of regulated activity (i.e., exhibiting). 
Licensure with the USDA must specifically authorize the use of exotic and wild canids, which include foxes. 
 
The licensee must either remove this animal from exhibition permanently or must obtain a new license which authorizes 
the use of this category of animal before continuing to exhibit this animal. 
 
Correct by May 24, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
